Whenever Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) lead the congregational%0D%0ASalaat, he always considered his followers. It is mentioned in Sahih Bukhari%0D%0Athat whever he head the crying of a baby, he shortened the Salaat.%0D%0A%0D%0AHowever, in the Nafl Salaat, Nabi (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) used to%0D%0Astand for long hours until his blessed feet became swollen. (Bukhari). His%0D%0ARuku and Sajda were according to the length of Qiyaam.%0D%0A%0D%0AAwf (Radhiallaahu Anhu) narrates, 'I was once with Rasulullah (Sallallaahu%0D%0AAlayhi Wasallam). He brushed his teeth with Miswaak, performed Wudhu and%0D%0Astood up for Salaat. I also availed of the opportunity to join him. He%0D%0Arecited Surah Baqarah in his first Rakaat. He would pray for mercy when he%0D%0Arecited any verse extolling the grace of Allah Ta'ala and would supplicate%0D%0Afor divine forgiveness when reciting any verse referring to his wealth. He%0D%0Atook as much time in Ruku and Sajdah each as he had taken in Qiyaam.'%0D%0A(Fadhaail-e-Aamaal pg.87)%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMufti Ebrahim Desai
